titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Stuart Tuthill Terry notes on Southold genealogy 1973.184
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2012-05-01T15:18-0400

did.unittitle: Stuart Tuthill Terry notes on Southold genealogy
did.abstract: One bound volume containing extensive handwritten notes extracted from the records of the First Church of Christ in Southold, Long Island, compiled by Southold resident Stuart Tuthill Terry. The notes emphasize Terry's personal family history and contain genealogical information on the David, Fanning, Horton, Terry, and Wickham families for the period circa 1640 to 1886. Included are records of births, correspondence, deaths, deeds, indentures, inventories, marriages, school records, and wills.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Gift of Mrs. Stuart Tuthill Terry, 1914.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Stuart Tuthill Terry notes on Southold genealogy, 1973.184, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: The Brooklyn Historical Society possesses an additional archival collection related to the First Church of Christ and Southold genealogy. Interested researchers are encouraged to view 1973.182, J.W. Huntting copy of records of the First Church of Christ, Southold, Long Island, 1858.
